article.headline: Nevada 67, Boise State 57
article.story: BOISE, Idaho (AP) -- Forward Nick Fazekas scored 25 points, including 14 free throws and Ramon Sessions added a career-high 23 to lead Nevada to a 67-57 victory over Boise State Thursday. Trailing 37-22 with 17:25 left in the game, Nevada (17-5, 10-2 Western Athletic Conference) went on a 31-8 scoring run to take the lead 53-45 with 7:17 left. Boise State (9-14, 3-9) narrowed the lead to 58-54 with 1:38 left, but six free throws by Sessions assured the victory for the Wolf Pack. Sessions' previous career high was 17 points against Pacific earlier this season. Nevada shot only 29 percent in the first half and trailed Boise State 33-22 at intermission. The Wolf Pack hit only one field goal in the last 13:47 of the first half and played all but two minutes during that time without starter Kevinn Pinkney, who got in early foul trouble and ended the game with nine points. Boise State was led by Jermaine Blackburn with 12 points and Jason Ellis with 10 points and 12 rebounds. The Broncos hit three more field goals than Nevada, but the Wolf Pack went to the free-throw line 36 times, converting on 28. Boise State was 7 of 21 from the line. Fazekas, who entered the game leading the WAC in scoring with a 21 point average, also grabbed 10 rebounds.
